```{r, message = FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(stringr)
source("helper.R")
```

```{r}
# Read in raw data. These are the files downloaded from survey monkey saved as a .csv

raw_data_general <- read.csv("data/occp_ma.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)

```

```{r}
# Pull out all responses for Q18 (a single selection question) and combine

Q18 <- "On.average..how.much.do.you.spend..in.US.dollar..on.consumable.cannabis.products.each.week."

Q18_general <- get_single_selection(data = raw_data_general, q.name = Q18)

  
## Determine Question N

number_of_people <- length(unique(Q18_general$id))

```


```{r}

for_plot <- 
  Q18_general %>%
  group_by(response) %>%
  summarize(count = n()) %>%
  mutate(percent_all = count / sum(count)) %>%
  mutate(percent_responded = count / number_of_people)

```

```{r}
# Plot with percents and response counts

r <- 
  ggplot(for_plot, aes(x = reorder(response, count), y = percent_responded)) +
  geom_bar(stat = 'identity') +
  coord_flip() +
  geom_text(aes(label= paste(round(percent_responded, 2), count, sep = "***")))

r

```


```{r}

ggsave(filename = 'Q18_OCCP_MA_Cannabis_Spending.png', plot = r, device = 'png')

write.csv(for_plot, 'Q18_OCCP_MA_Cannabis_Spending_852.900.csv', row.names = FALSE)

write.csv(Q18_general, 'Q18_OCCP_MA_Responses_ID.csv', row.names = FALSE)

```
